oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Camel Rock & Roll Dance Party - 1956-04-28 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: CBS Rock 'N' Roll Dance Party program sponsored by Camel cigarettes, 1956-04-28 part 2. Hosted by Alan Freed with announcer Roy Rowan, starring Count Basie and his Orchestra with vocalist Joe Williams, and special guest stars the Jacks, and Oscar McLollie. On this program, Jack Devaney (West Coast editor of Cash Box magazine) awards Count Basie with the 10th annual Cash Box magazine award, after the Count Basie Band was voted the top rock 'n' roll band of the county. Produced and directed by Lou Melamed.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Count Basie Orchestra; Jacks; Oscar McLollie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Camel Cigarettes commercial (Alan Freed) -- Alan Freed introduces Count Basie and his Orchestra -- Basie English (Count Basie Orchestra) -- Alan Freed introduces the Jacks -- Why Did I Fall In Love (Jacks) -- Camel Cigarettes commercial (Alan Freed) -- Camel Cigarettes jingle -- Alan Freed introduces Oscar McLollie -- Lolly Pop (Oscar McLollie) -- Closing statement (Alan Freed) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Roy Rowan) -- Next program announcement
